entry.title: The Antisocial Behaviour Notice (Advice and Assistance) (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations require a local authority to give advice and assistance to a landlord upon whom it proposes to serve an antisocial behaviour notice under section 68 of the 2004 Act.

entry.title: The Reserve Forces (Provision of Information by Persons Liable to be Recalled) (Amendment) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the 1997 Regulations in consequence of the Civil Partnership Act 2004 which came into force on 5th December 2005 by adding civil partnership status to the information which the reservist is required to provide.

entry.title: The Antisocial Behaviour Notice (Landlord Liability) (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the circumstances in which a landlord, who is subject to an antisocial behaviour notice under Part 7 of the Antisocial Behaviour etc. (Scotland) Act 2004, shall be liable for prescribed expenditure.

entry.title: The Law Reform (Miscellaneous Provisions) (2005 Order) (Commencement and Transitional Saving) Order (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation on 15th November 2005, Articles 3 to 15, 20 and 21 of the Law Reform (Miscellaneous Provisions) (Northern Ireland) Order 2005 (N.I. 17) (“the 2005 Order”). The Order also brings into operation on 1st February 2006, Article 19 of the 2005 Order. Relevant repeals and consequential amendments are also brought into operation by this Order.

entry.title: The Private Landlord Registration (Appeals against Decision as to Rent Payable) (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in connection with appeals under section 97 of the Antisocial Behaviour etc. (Scotland) Act 2004. Appeals under that section are against the decision of a local authority to serve a notice under section 94 (“the section 94 notice”) in relation to the payment of rent, or a decision of a local authority not to revoke such a notice.

entry.title: The Education (Additional Support for Learning) (Scotland) Act 2004 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order appoints the date for the coming into force of all remaining provisions of the Education (Additional Support for Learning) (Scotland) Act 2004 (“the Act”) not already in force with certain exceptions. The Act received Royal Assent on 7th May 2004.

entry.title: The Antisocial Behaviour Notice (Appeals against Order as to Rent Payable) (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in connection with appeals under section 72 of the Antisocial Behaviour etc. (Scotland) Act 2004. Appeals under that section are against the decision of a Sheriff to make a section 71 order in relation to the payment of rent following on from the service of an antisocial behaviour notice upon a landlord.

entry.title: The Immigration (Provision of Physical Data) (Amendment) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Immigration (Provision of Physical Data) Regulations 2003, as amended by the Immigration (Provision of Physical Data)(Amendment) Regulations 2004 and the Immigration (Provision of Physical Data)(Amendment)(No. 2) Regulations 2004 (taken together as “the 2003 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Scottish Water (Allt nan Corp) Water Order 2005
entry.summary: This version of the The Scottish Water (Allt nan Corp) Water Order 2005 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Private Landlord Registration (Advice and Assistance) (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for advice that the local authority must provide in connection with the registration of private landlords under Part 8 of the Antisocial Behaviour etc. (Scotland) Act 2004.

entry.title: Legal Advice and Assistance (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Legal Advice and Assistance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1981 to insert references to the legal status of civil partners, as created by the provisions of the Civil Partnership Act 2004, to ensure an application for legal advice and assistance from any person who is in a civil partnership is determined in a manner consistent with the existing Regulations.

entry.title: The Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (Commencement No.3) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order brings provisions of the Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 into force on 1st January 2006.

entry.title: The Scottish Water (Loch Bealach na Gaoithe) Water Order 2005
entry.summary: This version of the The Scottish Water (Loch Bealach na Gaoithe) Water Order 2005 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Antisocial Behaviour Notice (Management Control Orders) (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the expenditure which a local authority may incur when a management control order made by a sheriff in terms of section 74 of the Antisocial Behaviour etc. (Scotland) Act 2004 is in place over a house. It also provides that a local authority may recover expenditure from a landlord any time when expenditure exceeds income.

entry.title: The Legal Aid in Criminal Cases (Statement of Means) (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Legal Aid in Criminal Cases (Statement of Means) Rules (Northern Ireland) 1999 to insert a new marital status option of “Other” and to make reference to the legal status of civil partners, as created by the provisions of the Civil Partnership Act 2004, in the statement of means form which an applicant for free legal aid under Part III of the Legal Aid, Advice and Assistance (Northern Ireland) Order 1981 may be required to furnish under Article 32 of that Order.

entry.title: The Scottish Water (Allt Ach Na Braighe) Water Order 2005
entry.summary: This version of the The Scottish Water (Allt Ach Na Braighe) Water Order 2005 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: Act of Adjournal (Criminal Procedure Rules Amendment No. 6) (Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004) (Evidence on Commission) 2005
entry.summary: This Act of Adjournal amends the Criminal Procedure Rules 1996 (S.I. 1996/513) (“the 1996 Rules”) to make provision consequential upon amendments to the Criminal Procedure (Scotland) Act 1995 (“the 1995 Act”) by the Vulnerable Witness (Scotland) Act 2004 (asp 3) (“the 2004 Act”). Paragraph 2(2) sets out transitional provisions that are linked to the commencement of the 2004 Act.

entry.title: Legal Aid (Assessment of Resources) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Legal Aid (Assessment of Resources) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1981 to insert references to the legal status of civil partners, as created by the provisions of the Civil Partnership Act 2004, to ensure an application for legal aid from any person who is in a civil partnership is determined in a manner consistent with the existing Regulations.

entry.title: The Renewable Energy Zone (Designation of Area) (Scottish Ministers) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order describes the area of that part of the United Kingdom Renewable Energy Zone, (designated by an Order in Council, made on the 13th October 2004, as an area of the sea beyond the Territorial Sea which may be exploited for energy production) in which the Scottish Ministers are to have functions. This Order of itself does not devolve functions. Such a step would be undertaken subsequent to the making of this Order, via a Transfer of Functions Order under the Scotland Act 1998 (c. 46).

entry.title: The Disability Discrimination (Public Authorities) (Statutory Duties) (Scotland) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations impose duties on specified public authorities with the aim of assisting them to perform better their duties to promote equality of opportunity for disabled persons under section 49A(1) of the Disability Discrimination Act 1995 (as amended by the Disability Discrimination Act 2005).
